definition: to dispose of a matter/to be done with it
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
to rush through the work/to get through a thing carelessly
see 虛應故事|虚应故事[xu1 ying4 gu4 shi4]

sentences.english: There is no feeling that is too hasty to do.
sentences.chinese: 已经没有感觉了，就是做也是草草了事。

sentences.english: She is very conscientious and never skimps through her work.
sentences.chinese: 她办事认真，从不敷衍了事。

sentences.english: Britain and Italy should stop temporizing.
sentences.chinese: 英国和意大利应该停止敷衍了事。

sentences.english: They perfunctorily consoled him with a few words.
sentences.chinese: 他们敷衍了事地安慰了他几句。

sentences.english: The old teacher was muddling on, and nobody could follow what he was trying to say.
sentences.chinese: 这位老教师在敷衍了事，谁也听不懂他想说什么。

sentences.english: She is very conscientious and never skimps her work.
sentences.chinese: 她办事认真，从不敷衍了事。

sentences.english: Patients complain that their doctors hustle them through appointments.
sentences.chinese: 病人抱怨他们的医生看病敷衍了事。

sentences.english: Many college students used to rush through their summer fieldwork projects.
sentences.chinese: 很多大学生过去常常对暑期实地调查作业草草了事。

sentences.english: He always plays fast and loose with his work.
sentences.chinese: 他对工作总是敷衍了事，不正经干。

sentences.english: Many students in the course of employment because of their dedicated and halfheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 很多学生因为求职过程的劳心劳力而对其敷衍了事。
所以别再让前戏草草了事了。

sentences.english: Don't scamp your work because you're pressed for time.
sentences.chinese: 不要因为赶时间而敷衍了事。

sentences.english: There is the pilot program dodge.
Before then he was good at "fudging" through things but not enough.
sentences.chinese: 在此之前，他很擅长于马虎了事。
他敷衍了事的做完了这事。

sentences.english: There is the long-term care dodge.
sentences.chinese: 长期医保计划是敷衍了事。

definition: to have an accident/to meet with a mishap
to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
to stand aside and do nothing (idiom)/to take no part in
to keep the peace; to patch up a quarrel (idiom)
at worst/if worst comes to worst/serious/alarming
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
